thread.title: Keeping Up With The Kattarshians becomes a hit in Iceland
thread.title_full: Keeping Up With The Kattarshians becomes a hit in Iceland

title: Keeping Up With The Kattarshians becomes a hit in Iceland
text: Share this article Share 'And here we are, a year later, with the first reality TV show starring kittens. All the people who were laughing then aren't laughing now.' 'It's been amazing. I thought it was a cute idea but I never thought it would go so big. It's more than I could hope for,' she added. Inga puts the success of the show down to the fact that it provides escapism and offers viewers an alternative to the bad news on their television screens. The show has already attracted the highest-ever recorded traffic to Icelandic broadcaster Nutiminn's website The programme was created in partnership with the Icelandic Cat Protection Society As well as providing hours of entertainment, the show has been credited with raising the profile of animal adoption in Iceland All four of the kittens are soon to be adopted, and a new litter will replace them in the house 'We like everything they do,' she said. 'It's fun when they go crazy and ruin the house, but it's also calming to watch them sleep. It's good for the soul. 'There's so much bad news we read about in the media, and terrible things are happening in the world, so it's nice to sit there and relax and watch the kittens.' As well as providing hours of entertainment, the show has been credited with encouraging more people to adopt animals in Iceland. All four of the kittens are soon to be adopted, and a new litter will replace them in the house. Keeping Up With The Kattarshians is available to stream online . Read more:
